replies.body:
Because Support doesn't mean "play it Botlane".
And by shielding, slowing, Binding, and revealing areas Lux is a supportive Champion.
She has support things on all her abilities besides her ultimate. Q roots, W shields, E slows.

Because "support" doesn't mean "enchanter". You can support your team by dealing damace, cc'ing enemies, or sniping enemies that would get away so your teammate at least gets assist gold among other things.

For the same reason that Shen, Trundle, Naut, Zyra, Nunu can be played support.

The word support isn't (supposed to be) defined by being a pansy that sits on the backline spamming heals and shields and calling it a day. That is a TYPE of support character. That isn't what supporting is as a whole. These same supports can also be played as carries for that same reason in the other direction.

trundle can play anywhere because of his crazy attack speed
while shen can do that too because he is the most tanky champion on the game b4 rammus
hey when are you going to post on how pyke is a supp??? i am dying to hear your logic on that ;)
This statement shows that you're definitely not worth talking about logics with.
E is a vision tool with cc. She has all that she needs to support.

Lux is an aggressive poke support, similar to Karma, Sona, and Nami. While she does have some helpful effects to boost her team's potential, primarily a poke support's job is to constantly keep pressure, zoning the enemy adc out with the threat of either high damage or hard cc. While you can build like an enchanter on Lux and be good, without damage you still fall behind. Typically I go {{item:2301}} {{item:3020}} {{item:3174}} {{item:3504}} {{item:3027}} {{item:3089}} . 

Eye is obvious, so are boots. Athene's is critical on Lux, Ardent is mostly for the ap and the % boost to heals and shields (but the passive is good too, even gutted after the next patch). Rod gives mana, which Lux needs lots of, and health to prevent you from being curb stomped. Sustain in lane, and ap, a very good item. And Raba to finish it out since total this would give you about 430-450 ap (depending on your runes/masteries bonuses). It's supporty, but can still do damage, without being enchanter-built, or mid-lane build.
Or even better people call out in champion select screen "support" when they only build one support item {{item:2301}} and then just build full AP. I wish normal supports were back into this meta.
